keyMoments.description: Sanji dramatically arrives and rescues Sogeking from Jabra's killing blow, kicking the CP9 agent across the room.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Sanji's entrance into his major Enies Lobby battle and demonstrates his role as protector of his crew.

keyMoments.description: Sanji introduces himself to Jabra as 'The Hunter,' creating a Little Red Riding Hood fairy tale reference with Jabra as the wolf.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the thematic framework for their battle and shows Sanji's confidence.

keyMoments.description: Sanji sees through Jabra's deceptive 'Robin is my sister' lie and kicks him, showing he won't fall for psychological manipulation during serious battles.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's tactical growth and focus, showing he can overcome his typical weakness for women-related stories when his crew is at stake.

keyMoments.description: Sogeking falls for Jabra's deceptive pacifist act and gets brutally attacked with Jusshigan, being slammed into the wall.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's vulnerability when facing CP9 directly and his susceptibility to deception, setting up the need for Sanji's rescue.

keyMoments.description: After being rescued by Sanji, Sogeking apologizes for not being strong enough to defeat Jabra, but Sanji reassures him and tells him to focus on reaching Robin.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's humility and his determination to continue the mission despite his defeat.

keyMoments.description: Jabra tricks Sogeking by pretending to be a pacifist who hates violence, then brutally attacks him with Jusshigan when his guard is down.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Jabra's deceptive fighting style and his cunning use of psychological warfare in combat.

keyMoments.description: Jabra attempts to deceive Sanji by claiming Robin is his long-lost sister, showing her in a red-hooded cloak in a Little Red Riding Hood reference.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Jabra's repeated use of lies as a combat tactic and creates the fairy tale motif for his battle with Sanji.

keyMoments.description: Jabra's deception fails as Sanji kicks him mid-attack, revealing that Sanji never fell for the lie about Robin being his sister.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the limits of Jabra's deceptive tactics against a focused and tactical opponent like Sanji.

name.japanese: イヌイヌの実 モデル:ウルフ
name.romanized: Inu Inu no Mi, Moderu: Urufu

abilities.name: Jusshigan (Ten Finger Pistol)
abilities.description: A powerful CP9 technique where Jabra uses all ten fingers to deliver a devastating pistol attack

abilities.name: Tekkai Kenpo
abilities.description: Jabra's unique ability to move while using Tekkai (Iron Body), a feat most CP9 agents cannot accomplish

keyMoments.description: Franky rescues an unconscious Chopper from the sea after his Monster Point transformation and revives him by expelling water from his lungs.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's growing bond with the Straw Hats and his quick thinking in emergency situations, saving Chopper's life.

keyMoments.description: Franky races toward the Gates of Justice with Chimney's guidance, carrying two keys that might unlock Robin's handcuffs.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's commitment to rescuing Robin and his crucial role in the mission to reach her before she leaves Enies Lobby.

keyMoments.description: Chimney and her rabbit Gonbe inform Franky that they know the way to the Gates of Justice and offer to guide him there.
keyMoments.significance: Chimney's knowledge of Enies Lobby's layout proves crucial to the rescue mission, showing how even minor characters contribute to the Straw Hats' success.

keyMoments.description: Chimney paints arrows on the walls as she guides Franky, marking the path for other Straw Hats to follow.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chimney's quick thinking and helpfulness, creating a trail for the rest of the crew.

relationships.description: Gonbe is Chimney's pet rabbit who accompanies her everywhere
